result.execSummary:
The defendant Nelson Reed Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nelson Reed Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nelson Reed Stewart was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Judgment granted in favor of victim against the defendant for restitution in the amount of $133.80 joint & several with convicted co-defendant Jennifer Smull.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nelson Reed Stewart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court advises defendant of charge in count 2 of 16CM59/max penalties; advises defendant of charge in count 3 of 17CF15/max. penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to each count.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Defendant is a citizen of the US and agrees the facts support the charge.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms victim rights complied with and there are no VIS.  State to provide the Clerk with the victim name/address.  Atty Amundson informs defendant qualifies for 1/2 of IID, jail concurrent with sentence after revocation.  Court informs not likely to do that.  In 16CM59 court orders restitution of $133.80 and enter judgment in favor of victim, joint & several with convicted co-defendant Jennifer Smull; provide a DNA sample; waive costs.  In 17CF15 assess fine/costs $1807 to be paid in installments of $100/mo. com. 8/1/18; serve 40 days in the PCJ consecutive to 13CF43 and consecutive to any other sentence w/huber; 18 mos. revocation of operating privileges; AA/DSP; IID eff. LIC; advised of appeal rights; 16TR740 & 16TR741 dismissed as well as the other counts.

Defendant Nelson Reed Stewart in court with attorney Erika Amundson.  Defendant Nelson Reed Stewart in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  In 16CM59 defendant will plead to count 2, count 1 will be DRI.  In 17CF15 will plead to count 3 2nd offense, rest DRI.  17CF15 is on calendar for tomorrow.  Counsel has joint recommendation on theft charge to pay restitution jt. & several with Jennifer Smull of $133.80; on operate with restricted controlled substance, fine/costs $1807; 40 days jail; 18 mos. revoc.; 18 mos. IID; AA/DSP.  Court inquires of probation on CM case.  Defendant does not want to be on probation, he will be in prison for 15 mos.  DOC agent informs he's been revoked on ES.
PCSD served the annexed Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance on J.S. on 03/07/2017.
Letter from DA to be a motion pursuant to Wis. Stats. 906.09.  The State seeks to impeach the defendant...

Final pre-trial on April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on April 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on April 17, 2017.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for April 3, 2017 at 1:30 p.m..
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than March 7, 2017. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than March 7, 2017, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.

Defendant Nelson Reed Stewart in court with attorney Erika Amundson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of rights.  Defendant rec'd complaint, waives reading and requests a speedy trial.  Court shows NGP.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
